page.title: 06Tunstall Hills
page.content: { Tunstall Hills,}once known as "The Maiden's Paps" are to be found in our grid. They are part of a limestone reef formed 235 million years ago in the{Zechstein Sea}which once covered this part of the world. The limestone rocks contain many fossils of limestone{secreating}plants and tiny sea creatures which once lived in this sea. The name Tunstall comes from a village three quarters of a mile to the south. During the 19th century the slopes were used for{Sunderland {races.}Now they are marked out for several football pitches. A favourite picnic spot, the turf offers many wild flowers and plants typical of a limestone environment. A famous landmark for sailors they offer a {panoramic}view of the surrounding area.
